title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 January 2014 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
02:19 <lucaa> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:01 <Denis1> has quit  
06:03 <Denis> has quit

08:31 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <msmeria> has quit  
12:27 <vmassol> has quit  
12:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <vmassol> has quit  
12:46 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <vmassol> has quit  
13:58 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <vmassol> has quit  
17:32 <the\_codebot> has joined #xwiki  
18:59 <Emenems> has quit  
19:04 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
19:06 <the\_code`> has joined #xwiki  
19:10 <the\_codebot> has quit  
19:13 <the\_code`> has quit  
22:45 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
22:45 <cjd> hi guys, back in the states, flight went well and all of that crap  
22:45 <cjd> is now known as <Guest63624>  
22:46 <Guest63624> the people at the border all love me, I'm always so excited to talk about the ebox and stuff that they just smile and say "ok have fun"  
22:47 <vmassol1> Guest63624: cool, glad it went well :)  
22:47 <Guest63624> oh sdumitriu you're still using KDE I gather, I thought I'd give kubuntu a try, I'm impressed with the candy and the intuitiveness but I'm looking for a nice gnome-system-monitor-applet like thingy  
22:47 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
22:48 <Guest63624> thanks  
22:51 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
23:02 <sdumitriu> Guest63624: Yep, still KDE  
23:03 <sdumitriu> What's the monitor-applet thing? Do you have a screenshot/link?  
23:04 <Guest63624> http://www.sruz25.ic.cz/pictures/sysmonitor.jpg  
23:04 <Guest63624> CPU/ram/network/disk  
23:04 <vmassol> has quit  
23:04 <Guest63624> in the upper/bottom panel  
23:04 <Guest63624> which is quite nice for seeing what's happening on a second to second basis  
23:05 <Guest63624> is now known as <\_cjd>  
23:06 <sdumitriu> \_cjd: There are several things  
23:07 <sdumitriu> You probably know gkrellm  
23:09 <sdumitriu> I think that's actually a Gnome thing  
23:09 <sdumitriu> But I haven't used that since 200\*  
23:09 <sdumitriu> The KDE widgets are in an extra package  
23:09 <sdumitriu> kde-plasma-addons maybe?  
23:09 <\_cjd> sorry lag  
23:09 <\_cjd> :)  
23:10 <\_cjd> I was playing with yasm-scripted but it's on the desktop  
23:10 <\_cjd> I'd rather see something in the panel so I can see it all of the time  
23:10 <\_cjd> between that and the second clock, I know pretty well if I've paniced another kernel  
23:15 <sdumitriu> I checked, kdeplasma-addons has other utilities  
23:16 <sdumitriu> The system monitor widgets, in Gentoo, come from plasma-workspace  
23:16 <\_cjd> ok so nothing comes immedietly to mind as the #1 cpu/ram/etc meter?  
23:16 <sdumitriu> The plasma widgets  
23:16 <\_cjd> (for the bottom panel)  
23:16 <sdumitriu> I use one that shows CPU, RAM and Swap  
23:16 <\_cjd> yeah, I tried a ton of different plasma widgets but nothing was really that nice  
23:16 <sdumitriu> It's very good for me  
23:17 <\_cjd> what's it called?  
23:18 <sdumitriu> Shows more details, like CPU is split into user, IO, nice and system, RAM is split into used, buffers and cache  
23:18 <sdumitriu> "System Load Viewer"  
23:18 <sdumitriu> plasma-applet-systemloadviewer.desktop  
23:18 <\_cjd> cool, that's basically what I'm looking for  
23:18 <\_cjd> that and an aggregate network load meter and a disk load meter would be everything  
23:19 <sdumitriu> There are secondary system monitors for network, HDD activity, temperature...  
23:19 <\_cjd> also do you get a lot of segmentation faults in the plasma system?  
23:19 <sdumitriu> But I didn't find them that useful  
23:19 <sdumitriu> Not lately  
23:19 <\_cjd> because I'm getting them pretty steadily when I try to change widgets  
23:20 <sdumitriu> Checked, systemloadviewer is in the addons package, not in the workspace  
23:20 <sdumitriu> What version? I'm on 4.11.2  
23:21 <\_cjd> hmm crap can't find it  
23:21 <\_cjd> the version \*was\* in yasm but I lost that when I loaded my zfs /home  
23:22 <\_cjd> ahh 4.11.3  
23:22 <\_cjd> ubuntu ahead of gentoo o\_O  
23:23 <sdumitriu> Gentoo has two ways, stable and testing  
23:24 <sdumitriu> Actually it has a third way, from trunk/master, where it just gets the latest version from the source repository and compiles a package  
23:24 <sdumitriu> The stable is usually a few versions behind until everybody confirms there are no problems  
23:24 <\_cjd> ahh I see  
23:24 <sdumitriu> The testing version usually updates same day or a few days after an official release  
23:25 <sdumitriu> I have 4.12  and 4.11.5 in testing, but I like to keep things more stable  
23:26 <\_cjd> yeah  
23:26 <sdumitriu> Gotta go, ttyl  
23:26 <\_cjd> see ya  
23:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
23:48 <abusenius> has quit  
23:52 <polx> has quit  
23:55 <polx> has joined #xwiki
